Anyone else watching #InsideBestWestern? The corporate days bring back fond memories. One bank where we had to walk around a table and when the boss said the magic word, we had to touch bums, ankles and noses. Team building at its best 🙄

@GeorgieR30 @JournalistJill Jill was the first and only journalist I approached with a pitch last May which led to the best experience of my life with a photoshoot in London and a feature that was simply brilliant. Glad to have kept in touch and to call a friend - one of the best in the business.
@lynnettepeck @MetroUK Who is managing their PR strategy? I would be asking for a refund. Tone deaf, out of touch and least of all - nobody cares.
@KayWorboys I like a touch of mustard in the mash and a cheese topping melted to give it a bit of attitude. Proper food 😊

@GemmaR_DP A bet hate of journalists everywhere which is why I always give my contact details on any pitches. I am in the ERI with coronavirus but I will be in touch when I am cleared to get things moving for your readers on pothole claims.

I'm pleased to say that this lady has been in touch and I've offered to help her win her claim against Fife Council for free, simply because it's the right thing to do.
https://t.co/FFHDndWI0A
#potholes #shambles #RipOffBritain #ConsumerRights

@conor_matchett Whilst there is no money for community centres. Self-serving and out of touch with a grotesque sense of entitlement. We can't even get our roads maintained and the city is falling apart. Why should taxpayers have to pay to feed this lot? Disgusting. https://t.co/PYIK69738W

@stephbreakfast Being asked as an ice breaker to take part in walking around a table with other colleagues and when the boss said the magic word, we all had to touch ankles, bums and noses asap with a colleague. This was in a well known Bank.

@CarolineHarrap You're welcome. I can put you in touch with my IT guy in Edinburgh if you're interested in having a website professionally designed and built. He is excellent. Just depends on what you want and need really.

@ShannonDotKyle I contacted Edinburgh City Council this morning on here about a homeless man who is a longstanding feature at the bottom of the Royal Mile. Completely unacceptable. I will try and speak to him on Saturday to see if he they have been in touch (can't through the week).
@conor_matchett Happy Hogmanay to you Conor - I will be in touch later with some more firepower for your campaign 👊😊
@nicolelampert I was glad of it for the whole of April to recover from coronavirus and it helped me immensely.

@KateStanforth Try and stay at home if you possibly can. I was discharged from Edinburgh Royal Infirmary with COVID-19 asap as they said that I would recover faster at home + the risk of contracting a super-infection was high. The shared bathrooms are not regularly cleaned on the wards.

I will be honest and say that hardly a day goes by without me shedding a few tears. Every day is a struggle and it's going to take a long time to fully recover - my lungs, health and wellbeing are shot to bits. This virus is brutal and it has broken me.
#COVID19 #coronavirus

I am being sent home later today as I will recover faster than being in hospital. Still feel nowhere near ready but I will have some medication and will have to try and continue my recovery. I have done well so far by all accounts. Thanks again everyone for your kind words.
@FiShoop Ahh, my legs are still weak and ache from that walk I did last Sunday to the Castle. Way too much for the first time. I haven't done much since. Other than that, ok. Hope you get well soon 😔

@FiShoop You may have pneumonia and inflammation of the lungs - I did. I am improving thanks - legs are still weak and ache if I do anything much without suffering for it the next day or having to rest. Still coughing a bit but miles better. Hope you get yourself sorted soon.

@Dr_Ellie @rcgp @MattHancock @keithgrimes @catherine5news @BBCHughPym @accuRx @BBCFergusWalsh @Doctorkenny @NHSuk @NHSEngland I was missed twice by GPs in Scotland for coronavirus by phone consultations and even the ambulance drivers didn't think I had it after dialling 999. I had to plead to be taken to hospital and I was tested positive for it. I haven't heard of this here yet with @NHSScotland.

@WilsonC75HT I believe so. It's not without its faults - I was missed twice by GPs for coronavirus and it wasn't until I got to A & E after ringing for an ambulance when they found pneumonia on my lungs and inflammation. I tested positive the following day.

@CourantJames 2/enough, despite spending up to 20 hours a day in bed ill. Tests initially didn't flag any concerns in ambulance. A&E tests found patches of pneumonia on my lungs + inflammation. Tested positive for coronavirus next day. 6 weeks on and I still can't do a great deal/walk far.

@LebbyE @poornabell Mine were mostly viral hence why I was missed. It wasn't until I got to A & E after pleading with the ambulance drivers to take me that they found patches of pneumonia on my lungs and inflammation. I was put on an intravenous drip and tested positive the next day. I was ill.

@MartinSLewis I was hospitalised recently and tested positive for COVID-19. In for 3 days, lost almost a stone in weight, pneumonia on my lungs and inflammation. Still recovering from it - weakness in the legs and aching + lethargic. Knocked me for six. It's brutal.

@PeterAdamSmith @itvnews I showed no signs of COVID19 until I was tested positive at the hospital after a chest X-ray and blood tests which detected abnormalities. I had to insist on being taken to hospital - it was just suspected that I had a viral infection. I was showing no signs.

My sympathies are with #BorisJohnson knowing what the symptoms are and the struggle to recover. I tested positive last Saturday pm and I am sleeping up to 16 hours a day. Wiped out, persistent cough, shortness  of breath. Another week of self-isolation. Hope he recovers soon.
@CourantGeorgiaL Harrowing, in a word. Being told that you have tested positive is a moment where you wonder if you are going to live or die. It's nothing like anything else you can imagine.

@CourantBill @PrudhoeNland Speaking as someone who has tested positive for coronavirus, it is unlike anything else you can imagine. The scenes on the wards, the noises, the chaos - it's like being in a horror movie film. People need to realise that this is as grim as it gets.

@ElliotSiobhan Tested positive for coronavirus earlier this pm Siobhan. Hopefully I will be out within a couple of days or so. Patches of pneumonia on my lungs amongst other things but feeling better than I have for a while.

@WayneNorthEast @KayWorboys Me too. NHS 111 is hopeless as are the GP surgeries. Patches of pneumonia on my lungs amongst other things...should be out within a couple of days all being well thanks. I was tested positive earlier this pm.

@KayWorboys I have been tested positive for coronavirus. Just found out in the past hour or so. Should be out within a couple of days. Convinced that I caught it off public transport which isn't sanitised at all.

@WayneNorthEast @KayWorboys Me too. NHS 111 is hopeless as are the GP surgeries. Patches of pneumonia on my lungs amongst other things...should be out within a couple of days all being well thanks. I was tested positive earlier this pm.

I fell ill with COVID-19 symptoms on 17/3 and was hospitalised shortly afterwards, so I would have liked to have been made aware of it. Stronger for Scotland 🙄

@mark_mclaughlin @NicolaSturgeon I fell ill with COVID-19 symptoms on 17/3 and was hospitalised shortly afterwards, so I would have liked to have been made aware of it. Stronger for Scotland 🙄

@poornabell I am on week 6 from first symptoms and 3 weeks after being in hospital with COVID-19 and I can't walk far or do much without having  to rest and suffering for it the next day. Lingering cough is fading but lethargic.
@CourantJames You will be criticised for writing about anything unrelated to COVID-19 by a few saying that there are more important things going on just now. Can't win.

@journoannie @TheSun The 111 system isn't fit for purpose. I had to dial 999 because I couldn't get through on more than one occasion, 2 GPs fobbed me off by phone, the ambulance drivers didn't think I needed to go to hospital yet I was diagnosed with COVID-19 the following day.

@icod @CybillLiberty That's shit. I am still recovering from COVID-19 and coupled with a global lockdown, the furthest I will get is my back garden for my 50th. Hopefully Benidorm for Christmas will make up for it 🌷
@edinhelp Happy Easter Gayle. I am just sat in the garden recuperating from COVID-19 - stay safe 😊🐣🐱

@KimMcAllister I am, thank you. Pushed myself too much yesterday but I have to get moving again. All a work in progress - weak and aching legs are a problem, although the chronic fatigue and breathlessness is fading now.

@tropicalontour 6 weeks on from first symptoms and the fatigue, breathlessness and cough are fading but aching pains in my legs remain a problem. Can't walk far/do much without suffering for it the next day. Improving day by day. I wonder the same too.
@ElleRudd_ Same - 5 weeks on and lethargy, breathlessness with a niggling cough are lingering. It's brutal 😐
@kellyrose On the mend slowly thanks. Breathlessness is a big problem but I am eating much better. It will take a while to fully recover. Your cheese tweets made me howl!

Feeling better than I have done for quite some time but breathlessness is a problem along with an intermittent dry, raspy cough. So lucky to have my new neighbour to keep me in groceries. My taste & smell is returning. It's been a harrowing experience that will never leave me.

@KimMcAllister I am, thank you. Pushed myself too much yesterday but I have to get moving again. All a work in progress - weak and aching legs are a problem, although the chronic fatigue and breathlessness is fading now.

My symptoms started with an itchy rash on my right wrist, which was ridiculed by some at the time. This virus and symptoms are random and unpredictable. Worth a read.

@KayWorboys Yep - I have felt light-headed and unsteady on my feet for quite some time. It takes time and rest - all you can do. I have never spent so much time in bed. This cough though - roll on the warmer weather as a sunny day makes a world of difference.
@BerkshireBee I am home now thanks. Up/down. Washed out, niggling dry raspy cough and shortness of breath but I am on the mend slowly. It's going to take a while to fully recover.

paracetamol down at one point. I now have a rasping cough and shortness of breath and I am still confined to my bed for about 20 hours a day. The headache is coming and going. Completely wiped out and dried out with no appetite at all. I have lost about 9lb in 10 days or so.

@ladyjaney75 @dean_radio You went in to lockdown the day I started suffering from flu-like symptoms...I feel your pain after 4 weeks of self-isolation. Stay safe - at least the weather has been amazing.

My God, the howls of pain on this coronavirus ward will never leave me. It is worse than you can ever imagine. Please adhere to the advice - you really wouldn't want to be where I am right now. It's so difficult to cope with for everyone involved.
@MissPennyMoney1 Just had a Thai pork stir fry and cooking crackling now...you don't get a body like mine overnight. Yesterday was horrific so I feel your pain 😞

@LebbyE @poornabell Loss of appetite and smell and taste, fever, excruciating headaches for me. The symptoms are so random, it's difficult to detect and I was missed twice by GPs by phone and even the ambulance drivers didn't think I was ill enough to go to hospital. I couldn't look after myself.

@edinhelp Morning Chris. There is a homeless man in Canongate that really needs some help. He has been there for a long time and it's clear that he has made it his home. Nobody should be sleeping rough, especially in this freezing weather. Who in the Council can assist? Thanks - Scott.

@lambertvictoria Thanks Victoria. I thought I had turned a corner yesterday but I have had a relapse and I can't do anything without it setting off uncontrollable coughing, sweats and panic attacks. I am hoping to be out soon but I am not sure now.
